sen.j: 松平 定良（まつだいら さだよし）は、伊勢国桑名藩の第2代藩主。
sen.e: Sadayoshi MATSUDAIRA was the second lord of Kuwana Domain in Ise Province.

He was the second generation of the Hisamatsu-Matsudaira family of the Sadatsuna family line.

sen.j: 寛永9年（1632年）、山城国淀城代であった（のちに桑名藩主）松平定綱の次男として山城淀で生まれる。
sen.e: He was born in Yamashiro-Yodo in 1632 as the second son of Sadatsuna MATSUDAIRA, who was the keeper of Yodo Castle in the Province of Yamashiro.

sen.j: 兄・定次の早世により嫡子となる。
sen.e: He became the heir because his older brother, Sadatsugu, died young.

sen.j: 幼少時から聡明で知られ、慶安3年（1650年）に桑名城下で大洪水が起こったときには、自ら船に乗って領民の救助に務めている。
sen.e: He was known for his intelligence ever since he was young, and when there was a great flood near the Kuwana Castle, he went on the boat himself to save the people of his domain.

sen.e: He was known for his intelligence from a young age, and when there was a great flood near the Kuwana-jo Castle, he went on the boat himself to save the people of his domain.

sen.j: 慶安4年（1651年）12月25日に父が死去したため、慶安5年（1652年）2月23日に家督を継いで第4代藩主となる。
sen.e: Because his father passed away on December 25 in 1651, he took over as the head of the family and became the 4th lord of the domain on February 23 in 1652.
When his father passed away on December 25, 1651, he took over as the head of the family and became the 4th lord of the domain on February 23, 1652.
When his father passed away on February 4, 1652, he took over as the head of the family and became the 4th lord of the domain on April 1, 1652.

sen.j: しかし将来を期待されていながら、生来から病弱だったためにまともに藩政を執ることはほとんどできず、療養のために有馬温泉に赴くことが多かった。
sen.e: However, while great expectations were placed on him he hardly ever properly attended to duties of the domain because he was born with poor health, and he went to Arima Onsen often to recuperate.

sen.j: 明暦3年（1657年）7月18日、有馬温泉から帰国中に病に倒れ、京都で死去。
sen.e: He fell ill and passed away in Kyoto on July 18 in 1657, on his return route to his province from Arima Onsen.

sen.j: 後を養子の松平定重が継いだ。
sen.e: His adopted son, Sadashige MATSUDAIRA, took over thereafter.

sen.j: 家臣からの信望も厚かったようで、死後に家臣3名が殉死した。
sen.e: It seems that he had won his vassals' confidence, and after he died 3 of his vassals immolated themselves.

sen.j: また、正室を迎えることが生涯を通じてなかったが、それは町家の娘と恋に堕ちていたためともいわれる。
sen.e: Throughout his life he did not take a lawful wife, but it is said that that was because he had fallen in love with a merchant's daughter.
